snippet: The shotgun killings of snowy owls, which have struck five planes in the region in the past two weeks, have raised outrage.
abstract: Airport officials in the New York area are starting a program to trap and relocate snowy owls after reports that the birds were being killed with a shotgun at Kennedy International Airport; in the past two weeks, five planes at Kennedy, La Guardia and Newark Liberty International Airports were struck by snowy owls, which have been migrating to the region in far higher numbers than usual.
lead_paragraph: The shotgun killings of snowy owls, which have struck five planes in the region in the past two weeks, have raised outrage.

headline.main: Snowy Owls to Be Trapped Instead of Shot at New York Area Airports
headline.print_headline: Owls to Be Trapped Instead of Shot at Airports

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
